title: Platinum Party at the Palace: The royals were the real stars of the Jubilee concert
description: Alicia Keys, Diana Ross and Sam Ryder took to the stage, but the Royal Family were the real stars.

title: Partygate: Will Boris Johnson survive June?
description: The PM wants us to know he plans to get on with the job - but some of his MPs have other ideas.

title: Animatronic model workshop: 'Most people have never seen anything like it'
description: The owner of the Victorian Model Workshop believes it's the only shop of its kind open to the public.

title: Platinum Jubilee Pageant: Dancer Janice Ho reflects on playing the Queen
description: Singaporean dancer Janice Ho speaks to the BBC about portraying the Queen at the Jubilee Pageant.

title: Queen's Platinum Jubilee: The Nigerian boss who applied to be monarch's footman
description: Nigeria is the biggest former British colony in Africa but not many people are celebrating the jubilee.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'exercise'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Nykaa to Mamaearth: Start-ups fuel India's growing love for skincare
description: Homegrown start-ups like Nykaa have disrupted the Indian skincare market with their wide range.

title: COP26: Are nations on track to meet their climate goals?
description: Governments are due to meet in Bonn to discuss progress on climate action since COP26.

title: In pictures: Stars throw Party at the Palace for Queen's Platinum Jubilee
description: Performers from Diana Ross and Sir Rod Stewart to Jason Donovan and Sam Ryder played outside the palace.

title: The Queen meets Paddington Bear for tea
description: The Queen and the animated children's character professed a shared love for marmalade sandwiches.

title: Charlotte conducts orchestra at Cardiff rehearsal
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge was in Cardiff with the princess and her brother, Prince George.

title: Qatar World Cup 2022: Wales and Ukraine set for momentous play-off final in Cardiff
description: Wales aim to end their 64-year wait for World Cup qualification as they host Ukraine in Sunday's play-off final in Cardiff.

title: French Open: Rafael Nadal bids for 14th Roland Garros title against Casper Ruud
description: Rafael Nadal bids for a record-extending 14th French Open title against Casper Ruud on Sunday - in a meeting between master and "student".

title: Platinum Jubilee: Festivities to continue with Party at the Palace
description: The star-studded concert will also see Prince Charles and Prince William pay tribute to the Queen.

title: England v New Zealand: Parkinson removes Southee for first Test wicket
description: Matt Parkinson picks up his first Test wicket with a lovely flighted delivery that Tim Southee edges straight to Joe Root at first slip to leave New Zealand all out for 285.

title: Harry and Meghan: Royals wish Lilibet a happy first birthday
description: The Queen met her great-granddaughter, who is turning one, for the first time this week.

title: England v New Zealand: England take three wickets in three balls for team hat-trick
description: England take three New Zealand wickets in a three balls for a stunning team hat-trick during day three of the first Test at Lord's.

title: Champions League final: MP calls for retraction of fan 'smears'
description: Liverpool MP Ian Byrne wants "a full apology" for organisers' claims over chaos at the Paris event.

title: Robbie Williams: Fame 'intoxicating but isolating'
description: The Angels singer reflects on his 30-year career ahead of a homecoming gig in Stoke-on-Trent.

title: Met Office thunderstorm warning for most of Wales
description: Forecasters warn of flooding and travel disruption on Sunday amid thunderstorm warning.

title: Mariah Carey sued for copyright over 'All I want for Christmas is You'
description: A US singer says he co-wrote a song called 'All I want for Christmas is You' five years before Carey's 1994 hit.

title: Platinum Jubilee: What does Scotland think of the Queen?
description: The BBC's Scotland editor James Cook examines how the country's view of the monarchy has evolved.

title: Rapper Hypo stabbed to death at Jubilee party in east London
description: Police believe the 39-year-old, real name Lamar Jackson, was the victim of the fatal London attack.

title: Platinum Jubilee: How have we celebrated in the past?
description: From food for the poor to Ozzy Osbourne and Kermit the Frog - the story of two centuries of jubilees.

title: Shot dead by Sri Lankan police while trying to get fuel
description: The UN and human rights groups have warned authorities in Sri Lanka against using excessive force.

title: Tiananmen: Hong Kong students hide tiny "democracy goddesses" on campus
description: The anonymous acts in Hong Kong defy a crackdown on public commemoration of the killings.

title: How Henry the cat won the hearts of Addenbrooke's Hospital
description: Henry the cat has become popular with hospital patients and staff, despite not being allowed inside.

title: Queen Mother's car revealed by couple's detective work
description: A car lover bought it for £2,000, before investigations with his wife uncovered its royal history.

title: The Papers: 'We give thanks' and 'together... yet apart'
description: Gratitude for the Queen and reported tensions between her grandsons lead the front pages.
